page.title: 14Unusual Wildlife, Craignish.
page.content: In 1980 a pair of whales ,thought to be Risso's Grampus, were seen(& heard) in the loch. They were estimated to be about 15' in length. Two years later a leatherback turtle was stranded on rocks near a small is- land (reached by a causeway & just on the perimeter of our block).2 children (now both pupils at the school) were amongst the first to discover it.Fear- ing for its safety(the nights had been very cold)a plan was made to'launch'it (despite opinion that the 5'creature probably weighed about 600lbs!)but ult -imately it managed on its own! In Autumn (84) there were many sight -ings of what was thought to be a pair of black pumas (even in the centre of the village!).The mystery is still un- solved.This makes mentioning a wild herd of black goats (living on Eilean Mhic Crion) seem very 'ordinary'.
